data.title: Exercise 1: Learn and Play
data.description:
Welcome to your very first activity!

Before we dive into creating anything, let's take a moment to explore how the game works. In this step, you will play the Legend of Royal Institution (a maze game) and observe how it behaves.

Put on your game designer hat and answer the following questions:

  • What are the rules of the maze?
  • How does the player move through it?
  • What happens when the player hits a wall?
  • What marks the end of the game?

Use the text box below to jot down any rules, patterns, or interesting game mechanics you notice.There are no wrong answers - this is all about being curious and observant.

As you explore the Maze game, start thinking creatively about how you could make it more interesting or challenging. What new game mechanics could you add? Think about how these elements could change the way the game is played and how they might make it more fun or challenging. Write down any ideas that come to mind!

When you're ready, click the Save button to move on to the next step, where we will start shaping and modifying the maze game together!

data.title: Exercise 2: Changing the plot
data.description:
Great job exploring the maze game! Now, let's move on to your next activity—this time, you're stepping into the role of a narrative designer.

In this step, you'll get to change the dialogues that appear in three important moments of the game:

  • Game Intro: The message players see when they first start the game.
  • Game Over: What the game says when the player hits a wall or fails.
  • Victory: The celebratory message when the player finishes the maze!

Take a few moments to play the maze game again and pay close attention to the text that appears during these three moments. Then, think about how you would change it. Do you want to make it more dramatic, silly, mysterious, or even motivational? It’s totally up to you!

Use the text boxes below to rewrite each of the three dialogues in your own style.

Be creative and have fun with it! Whether you want your game to feel like a fantasy quest, a sci-fi mission, or a comedy maze is totally your choice.

Once you're happy with your new dialogues, click Save to continue. Up next: we'll look at how to bring your custom dialogues into the actual game!
